title: Sewwandi fled by boat, spent three weeks in India before reaching Nepal
byline: Police investigations have revealed that Ishara Sewwandi, the main suspect in the murder of organized crime figure Ganemulla Sanjeewa, fled Sri Lanka by boat from Jaffna and spent about three weeks in India before travelling to Nepal by road, spending nearly Rs. 6.5 million on her escape.

title: Limited export base restrains Sri Lanka from fully benefiting from EU’s GSP+ scheme
byline: Sri Lanka’s limited export diversification and narrow production base have constrained the country from fully capitalizing on the benefits of the GSP+ (Generalized Scheme of Preferences Plus) trade facility with the European Union (EU), Daily Mirror learns.

title: EV demand fades amid Customs fiasco
byline: Amid the government’s push to promote electric vehicles (EVs) as a key step toward reducing air pollution and advancing renewable energy, public interest in EVs is reportedly declining, the Electric Vehicle Owners Association (EVOA) has warned.

title: Bangladesh garment factory fire kills at least 16
byline: At least 16 people have died after a huge fire broke out at a garment factory in Bangladesh, with officials warning that the toll could rise.

title: Wanninayake files writ petition to prevent arrest
byline: Attorney-at-law Gunaratne Wanninayake yesterday (14) filed a writ petition before the Court of Appeal, seeking an order to prevent his arrest before being produced in court, in connection with an incident involving a police constable at the Mount Lavinia Court premises.

title: Madagascar military says it has seized power
byline: A Madagascar army colonel says that the military has taken charge of the African island nation after parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina.

title: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga dies aged 80
byline: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga has died at the age of 80, family sources have told the BBC.

title: Kopay Police withdrawn after court ruling
byline: The Kopay Police have been temporarily withdrawn from the area following an order issued by the Jaffna District Court.

title: Prime Minister to visit India from October 16–18
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya is scheduled to undertake an official visit to India from October 16 to 18, 2025.

title: Wanninayake to surrender before Magistrate’s Court
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake, through his counsel today informed the Court of Appeal that he would forthwith surrender before the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court in connection with an incident involving a police constable at the Mount Lavinia Court premises.

title: Namal urges government to keep promises made to the people
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa yesterday warned the government to fulfill the promises made to the people, saying that “enough lies have been told.”

title: PNB Director Hemal Prashantha transferred
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Hemal Prashantha, Director of the Police Narcotics Bureau, has been transferred as the Acting Commanding Officer of the Police Field Force Headquarters.

title: COPA slams CMC over unauthorized funeral parlour on Borella Kanatte land
byline: Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has taken Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) to task for its failure to take action against an unauthorized funeral parlour on the land allocated for the construction of quarters for the administrator of Borella Kanatte.

title: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara appears before bribery commission
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption today to provide a statement.

title: Sri Lanka’s wildlife parks face dual threat of overcrowding and neglect, audit reveals
byline: Sri Lanka’s lucrative wildlife tourism sector, a cornerstone of its economic recovery, is facing a critical challenge of imbalance.

title: New plantation sector wage hike plan lacks economic logic: PA
byline: Plantation companies yesterday pushed back against President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s bid to raise estate worker wages, warning the move has no firm economic logic and would saddle the sector with an additional Rs. 13 billion burden per year.

title: Lawyer Gunaratne Wanninayake appears before court
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake, who was involved in an incident with a police constable at the Mount Lavinia Court premises, appeared before the Mount Lavina Magistarte’s Court today.

title: SJB ready for any election
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) is ready to face any litmus test anytime and is ready to face any election, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: National policy on occupational safety, health in the offing: Labour Ministry
byline: A national policy on occupational safety and health is being drafted and is expected to be published soon, the Ministry of Labour said.

title: Over 12 civilians killed in Pakistani attack, Afghan Taliban say
byline: More than 12 civilians were killed in Afghanistan as fresh fighting broke out between Afghan and Pakistani forces on Wednesday, the Taliban said, rupturing a fragile peace that had briefly taken hold after weekend clashes between the countries killed dozens.

title: Eyewitness claims police harassment after revealing assault on lawyer
byline: An eyewitness to the recent altercation between Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake and a Police Constable at the Mount Lavinia Court premises has alleged that he is now being harassed by the Police for speaking out.

title: Sinopec assures speedy commencement of new Hambantota refinery
byline: A high-level delegation from China’s Sinopec Group has assured Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath, that the company will expedite the commencement of the proposed oil refinery project in Hambantota.

title: Manusha Nanayakkara arrested
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara was arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption a short while ago.

title: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga dies aged 80
byline: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga has died at the age of 80, family sources have told the BBC.
